column4: Someone help! :| I've installed UBUNTU on an old laptop....A sony X505.... ub version 9.04 everything is working great but files I copy to the system get corrupted..
I think they are mostly large files but I'm not sure. Someone give me advice on checking what's wrong
johathan... Well I copied a movie to it via FTP... then when I got home I tried to DL the file via FTP again.... xfer stops half way thru
just how old is this laptop?
try a different, smaller file and see if it is corrupted or stop halfway through
yea I did the small file.... transfered to ubuntu and back.... everything seems ok
ok then it is probably the FTP server dropping it. how big is the file?
try d/l'ing the ubuntu ISO & see if it corrupts/stops, how fast is your connection? I don't want  to waste your time
my connection is not that fast.... it would prob take about an hour.
what ftp client are you using?/
I have another linux box here. I could DL a large file from a local server?
yes try that & it *might* be the client. i always used nautilus or filezilla, I'm not familiar with that client
it sounds like the HDD has bad sectors that the FS hasn't marked yet
how can I get FS to mark them?
you reboot in recovery mode & the menu will have something about the disk or file system check
I forget what it is exactly
